strong: The real key to this position:

p.6: ***Must have AI/ML model development in a manufacturing environment, everything else is a plus
p.8: Data Scientists are responsible for participating in the implementation of continuous improvement projects using the D-M-A-I-C methodology of Six Sigma. Data Scientists leverage Data Science and Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI) tools to further data driven decision making across the company and influence positive change. By defining a problem with an unknown solution, measuring the current process capability and collecting data, analyzing relevant data, optimizing the process, and controlling key process outputs.

li: Utilizing Six Sigma principles with data science and AI tools, participate in and complete projects, analyses, reports, and visualizations in an accurate and timely fashion.
li.1: Provide support to teams by providing them with the information, analysis, training and tools to succeed; promote and demonstrate effective and "boundaryless=E2=80=9D communication to achieve "cross pollination=E2=80=9D in all areas, at all levels.
li.2: Identify, obtain, explore, clean, transform and analyze project data; Select, develop, train, evaluate, and explain machine learning models; and integrate, deploy, operate, and maintain Client models.
li.3: Lead and guide others in the practical use of the Six Sigma philosophy and Data Science tools.
li.5: Utilize teamwork and apply team concepts as a member of project teams and, as possible, in the day to day operation of the facility.
li.6: Travel up to 15% of the time.
li.7: Conduct and oversee Data Science training, as needed.

li: Bachelor's degree in data science, computer science, math, science or engineering, 2 + years related work experience and/or training, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
li.1: Understanding of advanced data science techniques for Supervised and Unsupervised Learning methods such as Classification, Regression, and Clustering Analysis.
li.2: Proficient in Data Visualization to analyze and represent data and insights to project team, management, and end users.
li.3: Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.
li.4: Ability to draft reports, business correspondence and procedure manuals.
li.5: Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and customers.
li.6: Ability to apply mathematical operations to such tasks as frequency distribution, determination of test reliability and validity, analysis of variance, correlation techniques, sampling theory and factor analysis.
li.7: Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
li.8: Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
li.9: Understanding of advanced Six Sigma and statistical process control concepts, including control charts, variation, cause and effect relationships, Pareto principle (vital few/useful many) and process capability.
li.10: Experience working with SQL, Power BI, SAP, MiniTab, RapidMiner, R, Python, or similar tools.

p.16: EEOC: We are committed to equal employment opportunity without consideration of race, color, religion, ethnicity, citizenship, political activity or affiliation, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, sex or gender, or any other basis protected by law.
